in postman I am getting the error 500

entry.title: does sap rest adapter(sender channel) in rest polling only read 1 message per poll from a queue
entry.content:
hi experts

I have a Rest Sender channel in Rest Polling mode reading from a ASB (Azure Service Bus) queue via Http endpoint. I am using SAP PO 7.5

i have observed that it reads only one message per poll from queue even though there are multiple messages to read. e.g. if there are 10 messages in queue and channel is polling every 10 seconds, it reads one message in first poll, then 2nd message after 10 seconds and so on. To read all 10 messages it takes 10 polls and 60 seconds in total.

Does the REST adapter work this way? or Is there a way to read all the available messages in queue at once using Rest adapter in Rest Polling mode?

entry.title: DCPPUSHSERVICE to create DP document from the XML received by SAP DRC via PEPPOL network
entry.content:
Hi All,

We are in the process of setting up the E-invoicing solution for Belgium, which involves configuring the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) connection for our enterprise. This setup will enable us to receive supplier invoices via the PEPPOL network as mandated for B2B transactions.

To clarify the flow: Supplier >>> PEPPOL network >>> SAP DRC >>> SAP ECC

We have reviewed the relevant SAP notes regarding the integration of PEPPOL data into SAP ECC. These notes mention the use of the DCPPUSHSERVICE for sending received data. We seek clarification and support on the correct configuration and any prerequisites or known issues related to setting up this service within the SAP DRC framework.

We are encountering an error related to the DCPPUSHSERVICE in the Belgium e-invoicing project. Specifically, the error states that there is no BAdI implementation found for the interface connector, impacting the processing of incoming Peppol invoices.

The relevant BAdI in question is DCS_INTERFACE_CONNECTOR. We attempted to implement a custom solution using the implementation name ZTXS_DCS_INTF_CONNECTOR, but the issue persists and prevents proper e-invoice processing.

We request support assistance to investigate and resolve the missing or misconfigured BAdI implementation error for this service to ensure compliance and uninterrupted invoice processing in the Belgium DRC setup.

Please advise on the next steps or provide guidance on troubleshooting if we encounter any issues during the setup.

entry.title: Work center & Routing
entry.content: Hi, I have 5 different work centers, and each work center has approximately 10 different machines. How can I add the name of one machine to a specific SFG code related to one work center to identify the machine on which the job has been produced?

entry.title: How to Use Parameters and Imported Archives in SAP CPI Message Mapping
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm currently working on a message mapping in SAP CPI and I'm not sure how to use the Parameter tab in the mapping editor. I understand it's meant for passing external values into the mapping, but I’m unclear on how it behaves at runtime or how to bind it properly from the iFlow.

Also, I’d love to understand how Imported Archives work in this context. Can we use custom Java functions from these archives inside user-defined functions (UDFs)? If so, what are the best practices for organizing and referencing them?

Any examples or insights from your experience would be really helpful. Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Issue Migrating Integrations to SAP Integration Suite via "Migrate Process Orchestration Artifacts"
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I’m currently facing an issue while trying to migrate integrations from SAP Process Orchestration (PO) to SAP Integration Suite using the Migrate Process Orchestration Artifacts tool.

I have successfully configured the connection to the Process Orchestration System, and the connection test is successful. In Step 2 of the migration wizard, I can see and select the integration scenarios available in PO without any issues.

However, in the Pattern step, where I should be able to select an integration pattern, no options are displayed, as shown in the image below:

Has anyone in the community faced a similar issue? Are there any additional prerequisites or configurations required to have the integration patterns show up correctly in this step?

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Integration of SAP CPI and SAP DataSphere using JDBC
entry.content:
Integration Between SAP CPI and SAP DataSphere (JDBC Connection)  
 
JDBC – JAVA DATABASE CONNECTIVITY 
 
Why Recommendation for JDBC Over OData API : 
JDBC is recommended over OData when consuming large-scale records (e.g., 100,000+) because JDBC streams data directly from the database with better performance and less overhead, while OData is optimized for lightweight, paginated, service-based access. 
 
Problem statement: 3337495 - OData API returns less records than expected due paging 
Pagination limits in OData and Ariba APIs can be handled in SAP CPI using a looping process call. 
 
Goal: Connect CPI to a database used by DataSphere (JDBC) and run a simple read data from the (Analytical Model / Table /View).  
 
For the Write / Delete / Update method, the attached SAP Help Portal Link has syntax in the reference section. 
 
Prerequisites: 

  1. SAP DataSphere – Subscribed account (⚠ Trial has limited features, JDBC not supported) 
  1. SAP Integration Suite – Subscribed or Trial (JDBC actions supported) 

 

SAP DataSphere Step by Step Guide : 
 

Step 

Action / Notes 

1. Create a Space 

DataSphere → Space Management → New Space → Name it → Create. 

2. Create Table / Analytical Model 

Data Builder → In your Space → New → Table or Analytical Model → define fields & data types → Save & Publish. 
*Verify Table/Model Deployed Successfully. * 

3. Prepare / Load Data 

Load data manually for testing cases. Otherwise load CSV/import to table via Data Builder/Data Integration. 

4. Note Schema & Object Names 

Record schema name, table name, and view names for JDBC SQL use. 
* Created space name is the SCHEMA name and Collect Table / Model name * 

5. Decide Where to Create DB User 

If HANA Cloud → use HANA Cockpit/DB Explorer. If on-prem DB → use DB admin tools or contact DB Admin. 
* We are using the HANA cloud system for practical session* 

6. Create JDBC DB User 

DB admin tool → Security/Users → New User → set username & strong password → Save. 
*Check Active status of User* 

7. Grant Privileges for the DB user 

Assign only required privileges (e.g., SELECT for read; add INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE for CRUD). Best practice: create role JDBC_ROLE and assign. 

8. Prepare JDBC Connection Details 

Gather JDBC URL (e.g.  sample URL from datasphere: z*********-abc.hana.prod-eu10.hanacloud.ondemand.com 
Format for CPI JDBC Material: 
jdbc:sap://<host>:<port>/?encrypt=true&validateCertificate=true 

 
SAP Integration Suite Step by Step Guide : 
 
Create a Package & Artifact 

  • In CPI → Design → Create a new package → Add an integration flow artifact. 
  • ✅ Make sure your CPI user has the required roles to create and access design-time artifacts. 
     

Go to Monitoring → JDBC Material 

  • In CPI → Monitor → Integrations and APIs → Manage Security → JDBC Material

     

     
  • → Add JDBC Data Source. → Select HANA cloud  

     

     
     
  • Provide JDBC URL in the correct format (e.g., jdbc:sap://<hana-host>:443/?encrypt=true&validateCertificate=true). 

     

     
  • Enter DB username and password (use the dedicated JDBC user created earlier in DataSphere). 

     

     
  • Save and deploy the JDBC material. 
    •  

    Apply JDBC Material in iFlow

    • In your integration flow, configure the JDBC receiver adapter → select the JDBC data source created.
    • Use SQL queries (SELECT) in the Processing tab or provide XML query body. Here, I’m using SQL SELECT * to fetch all records from the table.

     


    Step 1: Timer Start
     In this iFlow, the Start Timer is configured with a Simple Schedule → None → On Deployment, which means the integration flow automatically triggers immediately after deployment.

     


    Step 2: Content Modifier
    Use this SQL query to fetch all records with the body operation.
     SELECT * FROM "<Schema>"."<Model/TableName>"

     



    Step 3: Request Reply & JDBC Receiver Adapter
         → Use the deployed JDBC Data Source alias in the JDBC Material in the previous step and set Max records count based on your requirement.
    → JDBC Maximum Records per call:  2,147,483,647

     


    Sample data Response from JDBC Connection:

     



    References :

    CPI JDBC – XML Query in Body for CRUD Operations (Syntax Guide)
     link:
    https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-integration/sap-cloud-integration/payload-and-operation

entry.title: SAP PI PO JDBC UDF causing issue
entry.content:
We have been using UDF to execute a SP in our SQL server and recently we have updated SAP PO PI to SP31 from SP11. After update we face an issue with the UDF with SSL exception and have to use parameter "encrypt=true;trustServerCertificate=true." with this fix we are able to make it work. But I'm trying to understand why this fix is needed since the connection is working without any changes. it would be great if someone can help me advise on this issue and if there is any alternate solution for this issue.

the error i'm getting is shown below.

entry.title: Reusing OAuth Token Caching Between REST Sender
entry.content:
I'm working on a development where I use a REST sender channel to do a GET on a certain endpoint with an OAuth token generated by the channel. The problem is that, in the same execution, I have a UDF that also calls a process on that endpoint, and it needs to use the same token.

My question is: is it possible to use the token generated by the channel inside the UDF? I'm not sure if there's some limitation on the Java side for UDFs. Right now, to work around it, I'm generating the token again inside the UDF, which isn’t a good practice since I already have a token available.

Is there any method I can call in the code to get that token that’s already in the cache for this execution?

entry.title: MP: exception caught with cause com.sap.engine.services.jndi.persistent.exceptions720.Namespac in PI
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
We are facing an issue in SAP PI/PO where the message is processed successfully and delivered to the target system, but the sender receives an HTTP 500 error. In the logs we see the following:

MP: exception caught with cause com.sap.engine.services.jndi.persistent.exceptions720.NameNotFoundException: Object not found in lookup of NamespaceMapperBean.

Even though message delivery is successful, this exception still appears and causes the user to see a 500 Internal Server Error.

Could you please advise what could cause this..

Thank you

entry.title: MP: exception caught with cause com.sap.engine.services.jndi.persistent.exceptions720 in PI/PO
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
We are facing an issue in SAP PI/PO where the message is processed successfully and delivered to the target system, but the sender receives an HTTP 500 error. In the logs we see the following:

MP: exception caught with cause com.sap.engine.services.jndi.persistent.exceptions720.NameNotFoundException: Object not found in lookup of NamespaceMapperBean.

Even though message delivery is successful, this exception still appears and causes the user to see a 500 Internal Server Error.

Thanks!

entry.title: SAP Edge Integration Cell Offline Mode
entry.content:
Hi SAP Experts,

We are going to leverage Hybrid solution of Integration Suite and I have few open questions.

Could any one from SAP reply on this and share any documentation ?

1) Offline mode for Edge Integration Cell ( where no connectivity between Cloud and On-premises), As per SAP, they don’t provide any support after 48 hours of offline mode.

Is Edge Cell runtime will stop processing after 48 hours ?
Or
There is any option to extent support from SAP side.

2) Can we start/stop or re-send message from Edge Cell directly during offline mode ?
As per SAP documentation, it’s only possible from cloud.

Is there any solution or custom development required to action on those messages or channel during offline mode ?

Thanks,
Bijaya
